summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 8-10, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in continuous locked-down status, with signatures for each half-hour check. The dates correspond to the period immediately preceding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019. This document appears to be a corrupted or partially rendered digital dashboard or system interface page, possibly from an internal law enforcement or investigative system. It contains fragmented text, system URLs, and timestamps, but no coherent narrative or identifiable case details about individuals or events related to Epstein.

events.title: SHU Monitoring Period Begins
events.description: 30-minute check sheets begin for inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York, documenting continuous observation.

events.title: Continued SHU Monitoring
events.description: Second day of documented 30-minute checks on inmates in the Special Housing Unit.

events.title: Final Day of Documented Monitoring
events.description: Third day of 30-minute check sheets, dated the same day as Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The documents are 30-minute inmate check sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit (SHU).
The sheets cover the dates August 8, 9, and 10, 2019.
The logs document that inmates in administrative detention or disciplinary segregation were to be observed at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
Each sheet has columns for time frame, start/end times, and staff signatures for each check.
The dates are significant as they immediately precede Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
The document is a system interface page with a timestamp of August 10, 2019.
The text is heavily garbled and appears to be corrupted or partially rendered, preventing extraction of meaningful content about the Epstein case.
It contains internal system URLs (e.g., https://10.33.3.57/Dashboard.aspx) suggesting it may be from a law enforcement or investigative database.
No identifiable named individuals, events, or specific case details can be reliably extracted from the provided text.
The document is labeled as part of a data set (Set 9) and has specific file identifiers (EFTA00059906.pdf, EFTA00059928, EFTA00059929).
